pmRFIs.subject: GRG Column Cover vs Base Connection
pmRFIs.question_body: Please advise and provide necessary detail section concerning the connection that will be required between the column cover profile line to the B5 base profile line. We would like to understand what the horizontal component will be comprised between the two different materials. Thanks

pmRFIs.subject: Toilet Accessory Availability and Finish
pmRFIs.question_body: See below questions from Barclay Dean (Toilet Accessories) regarding product availability and finish. WA-12 is not currently available and no information is provided to determine if it is discontinued or just out of stock. Please confirm if an alternate mirror would be acceptable if this mirror cannot be procured. WA-14 does not come in a matte finish. Would a different finish be acceptable? They can also be powder coated if needed. Please confirm finish. WA-37 calls out for KB110-SSRE baby changing station but this item has been extremely hard to procure and Koala is phasing this model out for newer ones. The new model is KB310-SSRE. Please confirm if this model is acceptable.

article.example:
{ "title": "Mitigating Utility Conflicts: Flexible Design and Shared Contingency Savings", "labels": [], "description": "
Utility line conflicts often emerge during construction, leading to added costs and schedule delays due to extra coordination. The root cause lies in rigid design approaches that rely on outdated assumptions. To address this issue, incentivize flexibility in both design and construction processes. Designers should provide details that enable timely adjustments to accommodate field conditions. Additionally, consider sharing any contingency savings with the contractor to encourage budget adherence and proactive management of utility conflicts.
", "costImpact": null, "timeImpact": null, "isDraft": false, "status": "PUBLISHED", "coverPhotoFileName": "", "mentions": [], "customFields": {}, "region": [ ], "marketSector": [ ], "topics": [ "Accounting" ], "projectId": null, "projectPhases": [], "partnerIds": [], "playListArticleIds": [], "divisions": [], "specSections": [] }

get.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve company vault data with the specified ID. The request includes a query parameter 'isPersonalised' which is set to 'false'. The response will be in JSON format with a 200 status code. The response body includes information about the company vault, such as articles, user map, total pages, page number, and total elements.

The 'articles' field contains an array of objects with details about each article, including IDs, titles, descriptions, creation information, status, labels, topics, divisions, and more. The 'activityLog' field within each article object provides a log of activities related to the article.

The 'totalPages', 'pageNumber', and 'totalElements' fields provide pagination information for the retrieved data.

Please note that some fields may have null or empty values.

article.example:
{ "id": "66ffbae0f8e43e2749f3d6e8", "companyId": "75498", "userPrimaryCompanyName": "BuildWise Sandbox", "title": "Enhancing Bike Safety at Intersections: Innovative Curb Design and Intersection Markings", "description": "
Traditional curb design at intersections can pose significant hazards for bike riders attempting to access the Green Link from the road. The root cause of this issue is the use of standard curb design, which creates \"tripping\"-like obstacles for cyclists. To address this problem, the article recommends implementing a bespoke flush curb design that eliminates these hazards. Additionally, the article suggests incorporating bike-focused striping in the intersections to clearly identify potential hazards and promote overall safety for cyclists. By adopting these innovative solutions, the article aims to enhance the safety and accessibility of the Green Link for bike riders.
", "createdBy": "shanmukha.viswanath+1@buildwise.ai", "marketSector": [], "region": [], "createdAt": "2024-10-04T09:52:32.167308900Z", "status": "PUBLISHED", "publishedBy": "shanmukha.viswanath+1@buildwise.ai", "publishedAt": "2024-10-04T09:52:32.169307200Z", "coverPhotoFileName": "", "labels": [], "topics": [ "Accounting", "Risk Management" ], "scopes": [ "Constructability", "Cost Management", "Precon & Scheduling", "Project Controls", "Risk Management" ], "previousTopics": [ "Accounting" ], "divisions": [], "previousDivisions": [], "specSections": [], "previousSpecSections": [], "hasAttachments": true, "autoDraftFlag": false, "noteRelativePathToShare": "/v1/api/company/75498/article/66ffbae0f8e43e2749f3d6e8", "userViewed": false, "userLiked": false, "versionId": 0, "lastUpdatedAt": "2024-10-04T09:58:05.448589389Z", "totalViews": 0, "totalLikes": 0, "totalSocialActivities": 0, "totalComments": 0, "comments": [], "isDraft": false, "isFlagged": false, "userNameToDisplay": "sha viswa", "userNameTitleToDisplay": "Project Controls Manager", "mentions": [], "questions": [], "playListArticleIds": [], "playListArticles": [], "partnerIds": [], "projectPhases": [], "originIndicator": "KNOWLEDGE", "isArticleBookMarked": false, "activityLog": [ { "type": "Article Published", "date": "2024-10-04T09:52:32.709659800Z", "userName": "shanmukha.viswanath+1@buildwise.ai", "description": "sha viswa published a post." }, { "type": "Article Edit", "date": "2024-10-04T09:58:05.580406497Z", "userName": "shanmukha.viswanath+1@buildwise.ai", "description": "sha viswa edited the post." } ], "customFields": {}, "hasEmbeddedImages": false, "buildingSystems": [], "uniFormatScopes": [], "questionCreatedByProfileImageURL": null, "sample": false, "allEndorsedSkills": [], "auditDate": "2024-10-04T09:58:05.450684519Z", "likedUsers": [], "viewedUsers": [], "costImpact": null, "timeImpact": null, "projectId": null }

post.description:
This endpoint allows users to add a bookmark for an article. The HTTP POST request should be sent to {{base_url}}/v1/api/article/addBookmark.

### Request Body
- `companyId` (string): The ID of the company for which the bookmark is being added.
- `articleId` (string): The ID of the article to be bookmarked.

### Response
Upon successful execution, the endpoint returns a JSON object with the following properties:
- `successResponse` (string): Indicates the success of the bookmark addition.
- `companyId` (string): The ID of the company for which the bookmark was added.
- `articleId` (string): The ID of the bookmarked article.
- `noteRelativePathToShare` (string): Relative path to share any notes related to the bookmarked article.

Example response:
```json
{
  "successResponse": "",
  "companyId": "",
  "articleId": "",
  "noteRelativePathToShare": ""
}
```

This endpoint is used to remove a bookmarked article by sending an HTTP POST request to the specified URL. The request should include the companyId, articleId, and title in the raw request body.

### Request Body
- `companyId` (string): The ID of the company.
- `articleId` (string): The ID of the article to be removed from bookmarks.
- `title` (string): The title of the article.

The response to the request will have a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json. The response body will include the following fields:
- `successResponse` (string): A message indicating the success of the operation.
- `companyId` (string): The ID of the company for which the article was removed from bookmarks.
- `articleId` (string): The ID of the article that was removed from bookmarks.
- `noteRelativePathToShare` (string): The relative path to share any notes related to the removed article.
